notes.head: Note
notes.body: Sixteen Old English glosses were added in black ink later in s. xi.

notes.head: Note
notes.body: The Te Deum, Nunc dimittis, Gloria, Pater noster and Credo (fols 267-70) are not glossed.

objectDesc.support: Parchment. Flyleaves are parchment from the date of binding.
objectDesc.extent:
ca. 270 mm x 160 mm (dimensions of all - size of leaves).
250 mm x 113 mm (dimensions of all - size of written space).
objectDesc.layoutDescription: 32 long lines. The gloss is in red ink on ruled lines, line for line above the Latin text, in a script the same size as that of the Latin text.

handDesc.summary: Most of the text, both Latin and Old English, is copied by one scribe, whose hand is 'large and clumsy', according to

accompanying: The words 'to ye Lord Keper' in Parkerian red pencil and a printed armorial book-plate with the words 'N. Bacon eques auratus et magni sigilli Angliae Custos librum hunc bibliothecae Cantabrig. dicauit. 1574' are on the front pastedown.

history.origin: Ker 1957 suggests that the manuscript is perhaps from Winchcombe, because Kenelm's name is in majuscules and he precedes the other English martyrs in the litany (p. 12). Gneuss 2001 suggests Christ Church, Canterbury or possibly Ramsey (item 4).
history.acquisition: Given by Archbishop Parker to Sir Nicholas Bacon, the Lord Keeper, and by Bacon to Cambridge University in 1574.

admin: Manuscript described by Takako Kato with the assistance of Hollie Morgan and Sanne van der Schee, with reference to published scholarship (2010; 2013).
